intro: Trigonopyren sambiranensis, commonly known as the Sambiranensis Trigonopyren, is a rare flowering plant native to the rainforests of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and small trees. The plant is characterized by its trifoliate leaves, which consist of three leaflets arranged symmetrically. Its flowers are small and clustered, typically displaying a combination of white and pink hues. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
